sentences.english: China's mammoth economy may be downshifting.
sentences.chinese: 而规模庞大的中国经济也可能在走下坡路。

sentences.english: The rest of the way is downhill.
The old man had difficulty climbing the rapid ascent.
sentences.chinese: 这位老人攀爬这条峻峭的上坡路有困难。

sentences.english: After that, it is often downhill.
sentences.chinese: 这之后，就常常是走下坡路了。

sentences.english: They mean that you’re past your best and are now in decline.
sentences.chinese: 这意味着你已经过了你的巅峰时期现在在走下坡路。

sentences.english: Tourism are down and many hotels are operating in the red.
sentences.chinese: 旅游业在走下坡路，许多酒店惨淡经营，入不敷出。

sentences.english: The so-called movie queen is going downhill.
sentences.chinese: 那位所谓提电影皇后现已在走下坡路了。

sentences.english: He ascended the incline, and turned to the right.
Stgot-owned enterprises collect out of difficulty.
sentences.chinese: 国有企业下手走上坡路。

sentences.english: The customs figures show a steady decline in British trade.
sentences.chinese: 关税数字表明英国的贸易一直在走下坡路。

sentences.english: Huangshi clothing industry has made brilliant achievements while nowadays is on the decline.
sentences.chinese: 黄石市的服装业曾经有过辉煌，但如今却在走下坡路。

sentences.english: Changes of Zhang's mental state of producing and the improving tendency in his way of producing.
sentences.chinese: 张恨水创作心态的变化及他在创作上的上坡路趋势。

sentences.english: It reveals the slope on which the AAUP now finds itself.
sentences.chinese: 它暴露了全美大学教授联合会正在走下坡路。

sentences.english: The last part of the ascent is very steep.
Now teenagers always have thought that 30-year-olds are over the hill.
sentences.chinese: 现在年轻人总是以为30岁后就会开始走下坡路。

sentences.english: There was a steep climb on the road out of town.
sentences.chinese: 市外公路上有一处很陡的上坡路。

definition: uphill/upslope/to move upwards/to climb a slope
(of two vehicles traveling in opposite directions) to pass by each other
to drive a vehicle/movement of vehicles
to turn/to go around a corner
to step on the brake/to brake (when driving)
